newsitem.title: UK: HSBC slips on weak Hong Kong share market.
newsitem.headline: HSBC slips on weak Hong Kong share market.

text.p: Shares in HSBC Holdings Plc were indicated down 27p to 18.45-1/2 stg by 0722 GMT in pre-market trade on Tuesday following a weak session for the issue in Hong Kong.
HSBC Holdings listed in Hong Kong were down HK$7.00 to 226.00 in-line with a weaker bourse. The Hang Seng Index was down 336.82 points to 14,666.00.
"HSBC is just following Hong Kong. The Hong Kong market has been roaring ahead and was due for a bit of a pull-back," one market maker said.
On Monday the blue chip Hang Seng closed at a record high of 14,998.12 on record turnover of HK$26.48 billion.
